image.altText: Two men at press conferences wear suits and stand outside.

props.synopsis: With the fourth election in seven years almost upon Tasmania, one thing is certain — more is needed from politicians to ensure good government is the norm, not the exception.

title.children: Tasmanians weren't ready for this election — neither were their politicians

image.altText: A Parliament House in the early morning sun.

props.synopsis: All published polls indicate a hung parliament is the most likely result of Saturday's Tasmanian state election — who are the potential crossbenchers and what do they want?

title.children: Crossbench MPs expected to hold power after Tasmanian election

image.altText: A young man with curly blonde hair wears an apron and holds his arms up to display his biceps.

props.synopsis: Several witnesses have told the inquest into Brady Hubbard's death three West Ulverstone Football Club members lied to others at the club and "covered up" how he was injured. Those three men have now given evidence.

title.children: Footballer may have been thrown from ute and fatally injured, court hears

image.altText: Kelvin Smith wearing a red puffer jacket and beanie plays an upright piano atop kunanyi/Mount Wellington

props.synopsis: Kelvin Smith is a brickies labourer by day but he spends his downtime lugging his 206-kilogram piano to play in nature.

title.children: Tasmania's outdoor piano man finds TV fame

image.altText: hand puts a ballot into a voting ballot box

props.synopsis: Where can I vote? Can I take a selfie while doing it? Who are the candidates? All your questions about the Tasmanian state election answered.

title.children: Your questions about Tasmania's election answered

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: More GPs, more housing, more schools and teachers, no privatisation, more sports facilities, no hunting — here are all the promises made to Tasmanians by the Liberals, Labor and Greens.

title.children: See what the major parties are promising this Tasmanian election

image.altText: Photos of the roof of an old church.

props.synopsis: When Simon was a student at a Catholic boys' school in Hobart in the 1970s, he says the school was run in an "archaic, cruel" manner, and one of the teachers had a name for the strap that he would use to hit them.

title.children: Former student alleging abuse says catholic teacher had a rhyme for hitting kids

image.altText: Jake and Callum Robinson stand next to each other and smile.

props.synopsis: Four people accused of murdering Australian brothers Jake and Callum Robinson appear in a Mexican court. A legal document reveals two of the men have alleged links to the country's notorious Sinaloa cartel.

title.children: Surfers' alleged killers face Mexican court as document reveals cartel claims

image.altText: A headshot of Trump with a stern expression

props.synopsis: The US president has been diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency. Here's what to know about the condition.

title.children: Donald Trump has chronic venous insufficiency. Here's what that means

image.altText: Donald Trump in a blue suit and pink tie pointing with his left index finger while speaking

props.synopsis: The United States House of Representatives has approved the Trump administration's $US9 billion in cuts to public broadcasting and foreign aid programs.

title.children: Trump claws back billions in foreign aid, public broadcasting funding

image.altText: Stephen Colbert on set on his show pointing at his salt and pepper moustache

props.synopsis: CBS announces The Late Show with Stephen Colbert will end after the upcoming broadcast season, while a Democratic senator ponders whether political interference is at play.

title.children: Questions surround CBS decision to axe Stephen Colbert's late-night show

image.altText: Palestinian woman Maha Almassri wearing a hijab looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Maha Almassri was arrested at her son's Sydney home last week and had her bridging visa cancelled by a federal assistant minister.

title.children: 'Loving grandmother' released from Sydney detention centre

image.altText: A pile of bright coloured ants pile together to create a raft on water. the photo is so close you can see a reflection

props.synopsis: As fire ants continue their relentless march across south-east Queensland, a biological control expert from the United States warns "one or two selfish individuals" could destroy Australia's eradication plan.

title.children: Fears a few 'selfish individuals' could lose Australia's fire ant war

image.altText: Salim Mehajer getting into a car

props.synopsis: Disgraced businessman Mehajer walked free on parole from a Sydney jail on Friday, ending a long and controversial chapter with the law.

title.children: First stop Westfield: Salim Mehajer released from jail

image.altText: A smiling older man leans on the wing of a small plane outside a hangar in a country area.

props.synopsis: A body believed to be that of a missing pilot has been located in the wreckage of a plane in the New South Wales Snowy Mountains.

title.children: Body found in search for pilot missing in NSW alps

image.altText: A billabong of water sits inbetween rows of River Red Gum trees.

props.synopsis: The First Peoples of the Millewa-Mallee in Victoria have been awarded native title status with exclusive rights, meaning other people will need their permission to access some designated areas.

title.children: Historic native title ruling gives traditional owners exclusive rights

image.altText: USAID logo

props.synopsis: Freedom of Information documents obtained by the ABC show Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) officials sought to work out what projects would be affected by Donald Trump’s decision to close USAID.

title.children: USAID returns Australian aid money after DFAT request

image.altText: An Aboriginal women accepts a medal from the Governor-General, with an image of Yunupingu displayed prominently behind her.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most influential Aboriginal leaders has posthumously received the nation's highest civilian honour.

title.children: Dr Yunupiŋu posthumously awarded Australia's highest civilian honour

image.altText: Man in a navy suit with a white shirt and red tie.

props.synopsis: A director within Papua New Guinea's newly formed NRL franchise stands down amid corruption concerns relating to business dealings at a state-owned oil company.

title.children: Director of PNG's NRL franchise stood down amid corruption allegations

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australia's broader All Ordinaries index breaks the 9,000-point mark for the first time, as the benchmark ASX 200 set fresh records and finished the week higher. As it happened

title.children: All Ords cracks 9,000 points as ASX closes the week higher

image.altText: A man in a black and white wing suit with a helmet on flies through the air during a BASE jump.

props.synopsis: Tributes are flowing for the 42-year-old Perth man, who died after leaping from the summit of Sass Pordoi in Val di Fassa on Wednesday.

title.children: Australian BASE jumper James Nowland dies in Italian Dolomites accident

image.altText: A hooded man holds a laptop computer as cyber code is projected on him.

props.synopsis: Crackdowns and lawsuits over data breaches take years. Experts say "the right to erasure" would help individuals hold corporations to account.

title.children: Forcing companies to delete data would remove cyber 'honey pot', experts say

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, standing on a stage, wearing a black t-shirt, talking at a company conference.

props.synopsis: Mark Zuckerberg and Meta shareholders agree to settle an $US8 billion lawsuit over claims stemming from the privacy scandal involving the Cambridge Analytica political consulting firm.

title.children: Meta investors settle $8b lawsuit with Zuckerberg over Facebook privacy

image.altText: Illustration shows a power board with Mlaaysia's city skyline emerging out of it in blues and purples.

props.synopsis: Malaysia is hoping to become a regional leader in the digital economy, but environmental, resource and geopolitical challenges loom.

title.children: How this small nation has caught the attention of the tech giants

image.altText: signs calling to demerge tumbarumba

props.synopsis: A decision to split the Cootamundra-Gundagai council is applauded by de-amalgamation advocates.

title.children: NSW shire demerger ignites calls for other councils to follow suit

image.altText: A female doctor in a white medical coat consulting a woman.

props.synopsis: A pap smear or cervical screening isn’t the most exciting errand, but if you’ve been putting it off you may be in for a "completely different experience" than the last time you were tested.

title.children: Putting off a pap smear? Remember your options have changed

image.altText: Five men standing next two each other in a row and looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: The 98-year-old ran a camp for youth for two decades in Far North Queensland. He now stands accused of repeatedly sexually assaulting and having sex with a minor in the 70s.

title.children: Youth camp founder Geoffrey Guest on trial for child sexual assault

image.altText: A child whose face can't be seen sits on a small piece of climbing equipment in front of a coloured mat outdoors.

props.synopsis: Convicted child sex offender Andrew William Vassel was employed as a gardener and maintenance man at a childcare centre near Brisbane.

title.children: Child sex offender did maintenance at childcare centre where wife worked

image.altText: View of mountains in a golden yellow colour, hazy sky in the horizon.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Parks is reminding hikers to carry personal location devices and be well prepared when they head into the outback.

title.children: Larapinta Trail hikers urged caution after two rescues in one week

image.altText: a woman scowling in front of an airport fence

props.synopsis: Passengers abandoned mid-flight in the outback highlight that Australian flyers have few rights.

title.children: Qantas apologises to customers left mid-journey in outback town

image.altText: Aircraft sit at the gates of Darwin International Airport.

props.synopsis: The operators of Darwin's airport have raised its landing fees by more than 110 per cent, with some airlines already increasing passenger ticket prices in response.

title.children: Darwin airport hikes fees to 'more than double' anywhere else in Australia

image.altText: A laughing woman side by side with a man with white hair and beard pulling a funny face

props.synopsis: A lone tracker continues his search for Barry Podmore, missing in the same reserve where backpacker Carolina Wilga was found a week ago.

title.children: Man's family desperate for answers after backpacker's miracle survival

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A road rage incident in which a Canberra man was stabbed last year has landed his attacker with a jail sentence of more than three years, with the judge noting his motives for the attack were trivial and that he seemed to boast about the incident afterwards.

title.children: 'Brazen act of extreme violence': Man jailed over road rage stabbing

image.altText: Jennifer Love Hewitt stands in a doorway looked shocked, we see Freddi's shoulder

props.synopsis: Almost 30 years since the original vengeful fisherman took on a group of morally questionable teens, schlocky horror I Know What You Did Last Summer is back — and some familiar faces are along for the ride.

title.children: Jennifer Love Hewitt returns for I Know What You Did Last Summer 'requel'
